segments.text: I see the water pouring over the edge of the sink onto the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It almost seems like it's flowing in slow motion, like something you’d see in a movie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But what strikes me the most is the woman standing there, so unaware of the chaos developing beneath her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She seems completely absorbed in drying that plate, her focus is almost mesmerizing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already in the puddle, but she doesn’t even flinch.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but wonder what would happen if she suddenly lost her balance.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children, on the other hand, are up to no good, climbing on that rickety stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can see the boy reaching for cookies and the girl just waiting for her turn.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s a risk they’re both taking, but the thrill seems to excite them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can picture the mess that would ensue if that stool tips over.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And yet, the garden outside is so serene, contrasting sharply with this brewing disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sunlight filtering through the window makes everything feel ordinary and calm.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But beneath that surface, there’s a storm waiting to happen, and no one sees it yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a knot in my stomach as I watch, hoping no one gets hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Why can’t the woman just look up for one moment? She could avert this creeping disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR
